description: User asks to replace the media URL of an already scheduled Instagram post with a higher‑resolution version; the assistant retrieves the existing entry, schedules a new post with the updated media URL, stores the updated entry, and confirms the change to the user.

messages.content: You are the BrandPulse Calendar assistant. Help marketers manage, generate, and schedule social‑media content using the provided tools while respecting brand guidelines and audience insights.

Hey, we have an Instagram post already scheduled for World Environment Day on June 5th at 10 AM, but we just got a higher‑resolution image. Can you update the media URL for that post to https://cdn.example.com/highres.jpg?
Sure, I’ll locate the scheduled Instagram post for World Environment Day and replace its media URL with the new high‑resolution image.
I found the scheduled post (ID `entry_987`) for World Environment Day on June 5th at 10 AM. I’ll create a new scheduled entry that uses the higher‑resolution image and then store it in your calendar.
The post has been re‑scheduled with the new image. I’ll now record this updated entry in your content calendar.

All set! The Instagram post for World Environment Day now points to the higher‑resolution image (`https://cdn.example.com/highres.jpg`). The updated entry has been saved in your calendar with ID `schedule_555`. Let me know if you’d like to make any more changes.
